parallel

Class Barrier

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.Barrier

  • public class Barrier
extends java.lang.Object
    A class implementing the Barrier concept in parallel/distributed computing. Before thread groups wishing to coordinate on barrier points can use this class, a "setup" must occur either via a call to Barrier.setNumThreads(n) or (recommended) Barrier.setNumThreads(groupname, numthreads). Each of the n threads to "synchronize" on the barrier point then calls Barrier.getInstance([groupname]).barrier(); The threads wait at this point until n threads actually reach this point, at which time, they resume execution.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void barrier()
      main method of the class: it waits until _origNumThreads threads enter this method, and it guarantees that if a thread enters this method again before all threads have exited the previous barrier() call it will wait first for all the other threads to exit and then will proceed.
      static Barrier getInstance()
      returns the instance that was created by a prior call to setNumThreads(n).
      static Barrier getInstance(java.lang.String name)
      returns the instance that was created by a prior call to Barrier.setNumThreads(name,n).
      private boolean passBarrier() 
      private boolean passBarrierFast()
      the method is the same as passBarrier() except that it tries to avoid "spurious" notifications that could slow the system down.
      static void removeInstance(java.lang.String name)
      remove the instance named after the argument passed in from the known data-base of Barrier instances (maintained by this class).
      private void setInstanceOrigNumThreads(int n) 
      static void setNumThreads(int n)
      method must be called before barrier() can be used.
      static void setNumThreads(java.lang.String name, int n)
      method has the same purpose as the setNumThreads(n) call, except that it creates a separate Barrier instance that can be referenced by the getInstance(name) call, so that several Barrier objects can co-exist in the same program.

    • Method Detail

      • setNumThreads

        public static void setNumThreads(int n)
                          throws ParallelException
        method must be called before barrier() can be used. It should be invoked only once for each group of threads which to coordinate with the barrier() call.
        Parameters:
        n - int
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if it is called twice

      • setNumThreads

        public static void setNumThreads(java.lang.String name,
                                 int n)
                          throws ParallelException
        method has the same purpose as the setNumThreads(n) call, except that it creates a separate Barrier instance that can be referenced by the getInstance(name) call, so that several Barrier objects can co-exist in the same program.
        Parameters:
        name - String the name with which the Barrier object can be later got
        n - int the number of threads that will be coordinated on this Barrier
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if there has been a prior call with the same name

      • getInstance

        public static Barrier getInstance()
        returns the instance that was created by a prior call to setNumThreads(n).
        Returns:
        Barrier null if the required call to set the number of threads has not yet occurred

      • getInstance

        public static Barrier getInstance(java.lang.String name)
        returns the instance that was created by a prior call to Barrier.setNumThreads(name,n).
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Barrier null if no instance by this name exists

      • removeInstance

        public static void removeInstance(java.lang.String name)
                           throws ParallelException
        remove the instance named after the argument passed in from the known data-base of Barrier instances (maintained by this class). The caller must ensure that no threads will call the barrier() method for the instance to be deleted again, otherwise deadlocks may arise (some threads waiting on the barrier, and the remaining threads will never be able to call the barrier() method again unless they maintained a local reference to it).
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if there was no such Barrier instance in the data-base of Barrier instances.

      • barrier

        public void barrier()
        main method of the class: it waits until _origNumThreads threads enter this method, and it guarantees that if a thread enters this method again before all threads have exited the previous barrier() call it will wait first for all the other threads to exit and then will proceed.

      • setInstanceOrigNumThreads

        private void setInstanceOrigNumThreads(int n)

      • passBarrier

        private boolean passBarrier()

      • passBarrierFast

        private boolean passBarrierFast()
        the method is the same as passBarrier() except that it tries to avoid "spurious" notifications that could slow the system down.
        Returns:
        boolean true only when the barrier has passed
